dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: Do you want him to die? A very good doctor might be able to do something... but by the morning that leg with start to mortify... Edwina sobs. MISS MARTHA (CONT’D) It’s the only chance he has. CLOSE on Miss Martha’s intense face in the lamp light. MISS MARTHA (CONT’D) We need more rags and the saw from the smokehouse. Edwina, find the anatomy book. Edwina wails. CUT TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the low morning fog, WIDE on the women and girls of th Farnsworth school gathered around a small pit. Some are wearing black shawls. They open a blanket and drop something in with a loud thu Miss Martha reads a prayer, as Emily shovels dirt over th small grave.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: Out of the depths have I cried unto thee, O Lord. Lord, hear my voice: let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If thou, Lord, shouldest mark iniquities, O Lord, who shall stand? But there is forgiveness with thee, that thou mayest be feared. I wait for the Lord, my soul doth wait, and in his word do I hope. My soul waiteth for the Lord more than they that watch for the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXTREME CLOSE UP: McBurney opens his eyes in confused hor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edwina, in a pale cotton dress, sits by the door to McBurney’s room, waiting in the quiet house. Her head low and tired, she’s been waiting a long time. SUDDENLY the silence is interrupted by his horrified scre

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What have you done to me?!! Edwina rushes to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McBurney tries to sit up in bed. His pale face, covered i stubble, is dark, like a broken monster. Edwina pleads with him in tears.

dialogues.speaker: EDWINA
dialogues.text: I've been waiting for days to talk to you... He gives her a hateful look -- like how can you even spea me?

dialogues.speaker: EDWINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You don’t know how sorry I am!

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: (nastily) About what, my leg?! You could have stopped her! Edwina cries.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (disgusted) But, you helped. Miss Martha rushes in, Amy follows behind timidly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: What is going on here?

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: There you are -- the butcher! Miss Martha is stoic.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: We saved your life. Amy watches from the side, holding her turtle, afraid. McBurney looks at Miss Martha with hatred. MISS MARTHA (CONT’D) We had to do it. He blasts at her.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: I‘ll bet you did! Did you have to do it or did you just want to punish me for not going to your room.

dialogues.speaker: EDWINA
dialogues.text: It was an accident, she saved your life.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: You’re worse than she is. Did you lure me up there and plan this together?! Miss Martha stands tall.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you enjoy it?! Now you can keep me at your beck and call.

dialogues.speaker: EDWINA
dialogues.text: John--

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: Just bring me another bottle.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: You've had enough. Edwina tries to get close to him, but he pushes her away. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: Get away from me. Amy stares as they leave his room.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You didn’t tell me it was a house of mad women. Vengeful bitches... Miss Martha closes the door behind them. McBurney lets out a horrific wail 0O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The key turning in the lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marie is on lookout. Her small figure walks it’s length, looking out past the mossy trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edwina passes by the closed door of McBurney’s room. She stops and listens to McBurney’s muffled sobbing. Her heart breaks for him. CLOSE on Edwina- What have we become?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women are gathered around Miss Martha. We hear POUNDING from across the hall of McBurney’s rage, smashing furniture. Miss Martha stays composed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What are we going to do, Miss Martha?!

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Miss Marie said she saw Union troops approaching.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: If we let him go, he’1ll join up with them. He would tell them about our garden and our cow.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: He would lead them back here... They all look to Miss Martha. CLOSE on Miss Martha thinking.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: Exactly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s afternoon. With the shutters closed, light seeps int the dark room. Alicia carefully makes her way over to McBurney who’s res on the settee. She sits beside him, and talks in her innocent baby-doll voice. She leans forward, showing some cleavage.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: How are you doin’? McBurney turns to her and doesn’t answer. He looks at her like -- what the fuck do you want.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I tried to ease Miss Martha’s suspicions about us... I was so worried about you. But, I know you'll be strong again soon. She touches his chest. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: Can I get you anything?

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: Get me the key.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: Miss Martha would know if it went missing... You know I’d get in trouble for that.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: Just get it.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: Well, there might be another one in Miss Martha’s drawer with her valuables. He grabs her hair and pulls her head back roughly.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ouch, you’re hurting me.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: Get me the key.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: Alright, I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marie pumps water into a bucket. Under a large oak, Amy collects acorns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane, in a cotton dress, with a sun hat in her hand, walk alone to the stairs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who’s there? She stops when she hears McBurney through his door.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: It’s Jane.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Open the door a moment, would you? She hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please. Cc.U. She peeks in the key hole. She cautiously turns the key, and steps back. McBurney stands in the doorway, his face is red from cryi he’s been drinking. She is startled as he comes towards h

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jane. He grabs her arms. He’s desperate.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jane. Where are you going? She's frightened.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I’m just going out to the garden, Corporal McBurney. He pulls her closer, pinning her against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please --

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: Play a song for me. Would you do that, Jane? One of your pretty songs. Pretty like you. She tries to lean back, he’s scary. He lets go of her arms. Tries to be gentle. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m not really a bad fella, do you think you could put ina good word for me with Miss Martha and the others? Maybe things could go back to the way they were before... Will you ask her to let me stay?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: She seems to be doing that.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: I mean for her to say that I’m welcome, and for her to talk to me and let you all talk to me. Would you ask if she'd do that?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Yes sir. You better go back inside. She closes the door and hurries away.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BALCONY- EVENING
dialogues.text: Emily walks on patrol as the sun sets over the mansion. There’s nothing in sight; they seem to be in the middle o nowhere. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Martha and the others have tea at the kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I wish he would just leave.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: We have to wait until the Union troops have passed. It won’t be long, I'm expecting our men to push them back. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: Oh, Miss Martha, I’m so scared.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: I know, dear.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: He said he was going to kill me if I made any noise.

dialogues.speaker: EDWINA
dialogues.text: Oh, shut up. Edwina shoots her a look.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: Please. We must all be strong. He’1ll be on his way soon.

dialogues.speaker: EDWINA
dialogues.text: He wasn’t harming her. She isn’t harmed, is she?

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: But he intended to harm her.

dialogues.speaker: EDWINA
dialogues.text: How should we know what his intentions were?

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: Don't fence with me, Miss.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I don’t think he meant anyone any harm.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: Perhaps not, but we can’t be sure. Suddenly a loud CRASHING sound comes from the other room. Miss Martha stands up. Alicia screams. McBurney staggers in on his crutches, the revolver in his hand. He is belligerent. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: Well, well, what are you Southern ladies learning today? The art of castration?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Why don’t you just go?

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: Yes, why don’t we help you prepare your possessions and you can leave.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: Oh, I can leave now? Just without my leg! You’re done with dressing me up? I’11 leave when I god damn want to. Things are all about to change around here. Now I’11 tell you how it’s gonna be. The girls look at him glaring down at them in a stupor.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you know why Edwina pushed me down those stairs? And why your Miss Martha chopped off my leg? Because I didn’t go to her room, or Edwina’s. No, they didn’t like that -- He knocks over a side table which crashes down, a dish on smashing loudly.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: That’s enough.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: (forcefully) I‘11 tell you when it’s enough. Amy approaches him with her turtle in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh, please don’t shout, Corporal McBurney. You'll frighten Henry here. McBurney grabs the little turtle out of her small hands a throws him across the floor. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy bends down to her turtle in tears. She looks back at McBurney like he’s a monster. With regret, he leans towards her.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Miss Amy, I didn’t mean to do that.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Stay away from me! Amy cries.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: That’s enough. McBurney turns to Miss Martha. He points the gun at her.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: What was that? Miss Martha doesn’t drop her gaze. He feels the girls all looking at him. He lowers it as he drops his head.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you just kill me and get it over with... McBurney grabs a mostly empty bottle from a side table an staggers out of the room. The girls sit in shock, prisoners in their house.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh Miss Martha, what are we going to do? We hear O.S. a bottle smashing in the foyer. Jane starts sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: We're going to be alright. Miss Martha holds Jane’s shoulders to comfort her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MISS MARTHA (CONT’D) Now, Miss Amy, I want you take a blue rag with you in your basket and go out front. Pretend you’re gathering walnuts, and make your way to the gate and tie it on, and then come right back. Do you think you can do that?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yes, Miss Martha.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: Then hurry right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With her basket on her arm, Amy’s back is to us as she quickly ties the blue rag on the gate. Her hands tremble. A dark shadow comes into frame and falls over her, with t sound of a footstep. Amy turns to see McBurney.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: What are you doing there, Miss Amy? She looks at him a beat and takes off running. He tries t grab her, but she gets away. McBurney follows after her as fast as he can go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls all turn as they hear Amy’s O.S. scream. Miss Martha gets up to go out.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: Go inside and stay there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Martha walks carefully outside, looking around. She no one. The girls run into the house. We hear the dry grass under Miss Martha's shoes. The door of the shed shuts. Miss Martha walks towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Martha opens the door slowly, letting in a stream of light in the dark shed. We stay CLOSE with Miss Martha as she carefully looks aro her back against the wall. Suddenly McBurney appears in her face from around a corne holding a terrified Amy. Miss Martha gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls move together to the parlor window to get a bet look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on McBurney and Miss Martha face to face in the dim shed. McBurney holds the gun up close to her face.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: Please, Corporal McBurney. She looks him in the eye. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MISS MARTHA (CONT’D) Won’t you come inside with me? We have one more bottle of bourbon in the cellar. He looks at her, and slides the gun down her cheek slowly lowering it. He lets Amy go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE on the mansion as McBurney makes his way back inside pointing the gun at Miss Martha and Amy, shooing them ins

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: Get back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls scramble from the window and sit, terrified. Miss Martha enters with Amy, followed by McBurney. Miss Martha stands erect, between McBurney and the girls, trying to guard them in some way. McBurney looks at her from the doorway, fed up.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: The next one of you to try something is going to be sorry. Miss Martha keeps her voice down and controlled.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: Miss Marie, please go to the cellar and fetch that last bottle of bourbon. She slips her a key, and Marie moves past, avoiding McBur in the doorway. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: Amy, I thought we were friends... I never meant any harm to any of you. Look at me, look what you’ve done to me. I'd rather be dead than a man without a leg, hobbling around. I see how you look at me... your disgust and pity. He starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m not a man, I took your kindness and trusted you and you toyed with me and then butchered me. The girls stare. He looks up at them with a fierce look in his eye.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve had enough with your devilment. I’ve got four shots left, and the next one of you to try something is going to get it from me. The girls sit in terror. He raises his voice.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you hear me?! McBurney pulls the trigger and shoots the chandelier. It comes crashing down. The girls scream, Jane cries.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The next shot is for one of you. He staggers out. The girls stare, frozen in place. They sit in silence. We hear Jane’s whimpers. Edwina stands up, and starts to go. Miss Martha grabs her arms to stop her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: Leave him. Edwina pushes past her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Martha tries to block Edwina.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: Don’t make a fool of yourself. Edwina looks at her stone-faced and fed-up.

dialogues.speaker: EDWINA
dialogues.text: Get out of my way.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: No, Edwina, don’t. She shoves Miss Martha out of her way roughly and moves p her, determined. Miss Martha falls against the wall in distress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McBurney lies on his bed. He looks over as his door start to open slowly -- what is it now? Edwina stands in the doorway. McBurney watches as Edwina enters, closing the door caref behind her.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: What do you want? McBurney watches as Edwina uses all her strength to push sofa across the door as a barricade. She stares at him as she walks over. He watches her approach. Edwina leans down to him, bracing her arms on his, and ki him -- with all her pent-up passion. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her and pins her down, fed up with her -- he rip her dress open. She pulls him down towards her. Her eyes pleading for him He takes no mercy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Martha sits down with the girls around her. She is concentrating on a plan.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: You're going to just let her be alone with him like that?!

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: Hush, Alicia, we have bigger problems to solve.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I knew it was a mistake when you brought him here, Amy.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: Don't blame her, she did it out of the goodness of her heart... Now we must think... Since no one in this house is safe as long as he remains here. It’s just a matter of how we can rid ourselves of him.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Can’t we leave him back in the woods?

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: We can’t take the risk that he’1l meet and bring his troops.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: We could hang him?! Miss Martha looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: Let’s not resort to brutality... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: We can’t go on like this with him here.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: We shall have to do something, and quickly, about him. I’m very worried of what might happen next.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I can tell him he’s no longer welcome around certain people, if you like.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: You'll do nothing of the sort, Miss.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: You're an idiot if you think he’s going to take suggestions from you, Amy.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I was trying to help.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: Girls, please.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Will you go and get help?

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: I don’t want to leave you here alone with him...

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: He loved the mushrooms.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: The corporal sure did love the mushrooms we served him. What if Amy picked the kind -- some especially for him? Miss Martha looks at her, getting her drift. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: I see. A beat. MISS MARTHA (CONT’D) Do you think you could do that, Amy? Find some mushrooms for the corporal? Amy looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You'll have to be very careful that he doesn’t notice you leaving the house. Miss Martha grasps Amy's wrists in emphasis. Amy looks he in the eye, determined.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yes, Miss Martha. Miss Martha addresses the group.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: We'll make him a nice supper, we can invite him for a send-off... We’ll get out that smoked ham and make some biscuits and a bowl of your mushrooms sauteed in butter and wine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on McBurney and Edwina asleep in bed, her face rest against his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the late afternoon sun, Amy walks with her basket, stopping here and there to pick mushrooms. FADE OUT.  90. INT. MISS MARTHA’S ROOM - EVENING Alone in her room, Miss Martha kneels and prays.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ALICIA’S ROOM - NIGHT CLOSE on Alicia in a mirror as she buttons up a special dress.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. GIRLS’ ROOM -NIGHT CLOSE on Amy and Jane braiding their hair, in quiet concentration. The room is quiet. The sound of cicadas start outside the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dim candlelight, Miss Martha walks down the hall w a quiet, determined reserve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful table is set with candles, wildflowers and platters of food. Miss Martha and the rest of the household sit around the table, dressed up in their finery. Miss Martha wears taff and earrings, the girls in their holiday dresses. Miss Martha and the girls look up as McBurney comes in followed by Edwina. He is wearing his washed and mended uniform. McBurney smiles at the warm hospitality. Edwina, at his side, has her hair down and wears a pretty dress. With he flushed cheeks, for the first time she looks unwound. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at McBurney as they look at each other like -- Isn’t this nice? They sit down and join the party. The girls pass the plat around. Edwina is oblivious to their plan. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: Corporal, we'd like to let you know that we harbor no ill feelings, and made this meal in commemoration of your journey ahead.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: Thank you for excusing my outburst.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: Think nothing of it.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: And thank you for this-- This looks like just about the finest meal I’ve ever seen. Edwina is pleased that harmony is restored. Jane looks across at Emily. Platters are passed around with the ham, corn bread, gree

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: Bon Appetit. Oh, wait-- wait. We haven't said grace. They put the platters down. Everyone lowers their heads. MISS MARTHA (CONT’D) The Lord is gracious and full of compassion; slow to anger, and of great mercy. Bless us and these thy gifts which we receive from thy bountiful goodness, through Jesus Christ, our Lord, Amen. Miss Martha looks up.

dialogues.speaker: GIRLS
dialogues.text: Amen. The girls pass the platters. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: Where are the mushrooms?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Here they are. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She passes them. Wine is poured for McBurney.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA
dialogues.text: Miss Amelia picked these mushrooms today. Who would like some? Corporal?

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: Yes, ma’am, I’m fond of them. Edwina looks at him with love. Close on the bowl of mushrooms being passed over to him silently, from girl to girl, no one taking any. The bowl is handed to McBurney. All eyes are on him.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What about you, Miss Morrow? Jane and Emily look to Edwina who is oblivious and lost i romantic thoughts. She speaks with a gentle smile.

dialogues.speaker: EDWINA
dialogues.text: Thank you. He starts to serve her some. The girls look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: But, Miss Edwina, you don’t like mushrooms. Jane and Emily stare.

dialogues.speaker: EDWINA
dialogues.text: It’s true, I don’t really.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY
dialogues.text: All right, then. He helps himself. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They look mighty tasty... and I am hungry! He gives a look to Edwina. She giggles. Amy stares as McBurney piles the mushrooms on his plate.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mmmm... Miss Amy, you picked these yourself? Amy nods. CLOSE on Amy’s hand under the table as she squeezes the g next to her. They all watch as McBurney eats up the mushrooms, washing them down with wine. He smiles, his mouth full of food.

dialogues.speaker: MCBURNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t plan to stay here much longer, but while I am here, I'll try to make it up to you for all the unfortunate things that happened. Miss Martha smiles graciously at him. He takes another big forkful of mushrooms and swallows th down with more wine. The girls watch him. McBurney with perspiration on his forehead, tries to unlo his collar. He starts to choke, realizing something is wr He looks up. The united women calmly watch. Edwina grasps him, in confused desperation.

dialogues.text: John? John? C.U. McBurney, on the verge of unconsciousness, looks at all, realizing... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: McBurney collapses to the floor. Edwina falls down to him She tries to lift his heavy unconscious body. It’s no use CUT TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MARTHA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Keep your stitches in a straight line like I showed you. We SEE the girls kneeling around their project on the fro porch as Miss Martha looms over them. Edwina, completely broken, is in a numb daze at her side. Martha gives her a nod.

dialogues.text: Edwina. Edwina, looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: EDWINA, (SOFTLY)
dialogues.text: Yes, Miss Martha. She takes her old place at Martha’s side, overseeing the girls’ work.

dialogues.speaker: EDWINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not so tight, Miss Jane.

dialogues.speaker: THE MANSION
dialogues.text: The girls carry the body bag down the walkway towards the gate, and drop it there.

dialogues.speaker: VIEW THROUGH THE BARS OF THE GATE
dialogues.text: The women and girls of the Farnsworth school, in their fa dresses, sit on the grand porch, waiting. CUT TO BLACK.
